meanings.definition: Of little worth or importance; trivial
meanings.sent1: The toy he offered in exchange for the rare comic book was the paltriest thing I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her paltriest excuse for being late was that she couldn't find her keys.
meanings.sent3: The paltriest item in the treasure chest turned out to be a plastic ring.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the grand feast, the paltriest dish on the table was a single olive.
meanings.sent5: The paltriest star in the sky seemed to twinkle the brightest that night.

meanings.sent1: The broken watch was the paltriest item at the pawn shop.
meanings.sent2: His paltriest possession was a torn photograph of his childhood home.
meanings.sent3: She found herself in possession of the paltriest trinket from the antique store.
meanings.sent4: The paltriest coin in his collection turned out to be a counterfeit.
meanings.sent5: The paltriest painting in the gallery caught her eye with its unique colors.

meanings.definition: Meager or insignificant in amount or quality
meanings.sent1: The paltriest amount of sugar was left in the jar for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: His paltriest attempt at a joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The paltriest flower in the garden still managed to brighten up the corner.
meanings.sent4: Even the paltriest hint of a smile from her made his day brighter.
meanings.sent5: The paltriest sound of the wind through the trees brought a sense of peace to the park.
